subtitle: Serve with freshly cooked buttery mashed potatoes and baked tomatoes.

method.text: Cut the leeks into julienne strips and place in a steamer. Sprinkle with oil and lemon juice.
Place the haddock, skin side down, on top. Set the steamer over a pan of boiling water. Cover and steam for 10-15 min until the leeks are cooked but firm and the fish is cooked through.

Meanwhile, stir 4 tablespoons of the white wine into the arrowroot. Heat the remaining wine to boiling point. Add the arrowroot mixture and stir until thickened. Stir in the cheese all at once. Remove from the heat.
Stir until smooth. Add the cream and stir again. Keep the sauce hot.
Serve a little of the sauce over the fish and leeks and put the remainder of the sauce into a sauce boat to serve.

title: Smoked haddock with velvet sauce
